src:
Liga Champions: Klopp Tidak Puas Dengan Trio Baru Liverpool
06 Nov 2019, 00:53 by Terjemahan, Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Lini depan Liverpool menghadirkan formasi baru usai mengalahkan Genk di laga lanjutan Liga Champions. Bila biasanya trio Salah-Firmino-Mane menjadi ujung tombak, di laga Rabu dini hari tadi, berubah menjadi Salah-Chamberlain-Origi.
Hampir sepanjang laga ketiganya bahu membahu menggempur pertahanan Genk. Jelang akhir laga, Klopp baru menggantikan Chamberlain dan Origi dengan Mane dan Firmino.
Klopp mengatakan ketiga pemain depannya belum bermain tampil bersamaan. Namun ia tidak merasa puas dengan penampilan di lini depan. Menurut dia, Liverpool tidak menyelesaikan situasi yang seharusnya bisa membuka peluang terjadinya gol, terutama di babak pertama.
"Jika kami mencetak dua atau tiga gol di babak pertama, tidak ada yang mengira itu tidak terjadi. Tapi hasilnya 1-1 dan kemudian menjadi rumit," kata manajer asal Jerman ini.
Di akhir laga, Liverpool menang 2-1 atas Genk. Dua gol The Reds dicetak oleh Wijnaldum (menit 14) dan Chamberlain (53). Sementara gol balasan Genk dikemas oleh Mbwana Samatta (40)
Meski demikian, Klopp senang para pemainnya tidak mengalami cedera. Sebab di laga selanjutnya di Liga Inggris, Liverpool akan menghadapi rival terberat, yakni Manchester City. "Hal paling penting saat ini ialah kami menang dan tidak ada yang cedera," kata dia.

UEFA
text:
Champions League: Klopp Not Satisfied With Liverpool's New Trio
Nov 6 2019, 00:53 by the translation, Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Liverpool's front line presents a new formation after beating Genk in the Champions League follow-up. If the Salah-Firmino-Mane trio is usually the spearhead, in the match this Wednesday morning, it turns into Salah-Chamberlain-Origi.
For most of the game the three worked hand in hand to pound the defense of Genk. Near the end of the fight, Klopp replaced Chamberlain and Origi with Mane and Firmino.
Klopp said the three front players had not played together. But he was not satisfied with the appearance on the front lines. According to him, Liverpool did not resolve the situation that should have opened up opportunities for goals, especially in the first half.
"If we score two or three goals in the first half, nobody thinks that didn't happen. But the result is 1-1 and then it becomes complicated," said the German manager.
At the end of the match, Liverpool won 2-1 over Genk. The Reds scored two goals by Wijnaldum (minute 14) and Chamberlain (53). While Genk replies goals packed by Mbwana Samatta (40)
However, Klopp is glad his players were not injured. Because in the next match in the English League, Liverpool will face the toughest rivals, namely Manchester City. "The most important thing right now is we won and no one was injured," he said.

UEFA
